sentence.text: Patient 4 was diagnosed with CHH at 4 months.
She had short stature with short limbs, sparse hair, joint hypermobility and varus deformity.
Her growth followed the −5.0 SDS curve.
At 2 years, she presented with severe anemia (Hb 45 g/L) and almost total erythroaplasia on bone marrow evaluation.
Anemia recovered spontaneously and the etiology remained unknown.
At 6.5 years, she developed aggressive B-cell lymphoma.
Primary tumor was detected in the adrenal gland and pulmonary metastases were present at diagnosis.
Treatment was unsuccessful and she died at the age of 7 years.
